page.title: 15WILDLIFE
page.content: On the Eildon Hills there are many different kinds of birds including Red Grouse,Meadow Pipit,Wheatear and Skylark.There are also hares,foxes and adders on the Eildons. In Bowden Burn some small trout can be caught,but its waters are sometimes polluted and the pair of dippers which nested there have disappeared.Kingfishers have not been seen for a few years.A few other species of birds,like wrens and treecreepers,which were wiped out in Bowden in the winter of 1962 are,however,returning.This is altogether a most interesting area. Some unusal flowers include Heath Milkwort,Bog Asphodel,Corn Cockle, Sweet Ciceelyor Horehound and Wood Anemone.
